trans-unit.source: Enabling remote JMX with password authentication only

seg-source.mrk: Enabling remote JMX with password authentication only

target.mrk: Enabling remote JMX with password authentication only

trans-unit.source: Some JVMs include built-in support for JMX password authentication.

seg-source.mrk: Some JVMs include built-in support for JMX password authentication.

target.mrk: Some JVMs include built-in support for JMX password authentication.

seg-source.mrk: Java Management Extensions (JMX) technology

target.mrk: Java Management Extensions (JMX) technology

seg-source.mrk: JMX

target.mrk: JMX

seg-source.mrk: enabling with password authentication

target.mrk: enabling with password authentication

trans-unit.source: For example, with Oracle Java Development Kit (JDK) 6 or later, authentication is enabled by default, and it is possible to specify a properties file that contains usernames and passwords. The properties file syntax is the same as for other Java properties files.

seg-source.mrk: For example, with Oracle Java Development Kit (JDK) 6 or later, authentication is enabled by default, and it is possible to specify a properties file that contains usernames and passwords.
The properties file syntax is the same as for other Java properties files.

target.mrk: For example, with Oracle Java Development Kit (JDK) 6 or later, authentication is enabled by default, and it is possible to specify a properties file that contains usernames and passwords.
The properties file syntax is the same as for other Java properties files.

trans-unit.source: When authentication is enabled and a Java Security Manager is installed, additional permissions may need to be granted to users in the security policy used. See <xref href="radminjmxenablepolicy.dita#radminjmxenablepolicy"></xref> for details.

seg-source.mrk: When authentication is enabled and a Java Security Manager is installed, additional permissions may need to be granted to users in the security policy used.
See <xref href="radminjmxenablepolicy.dita#radminjmxenablepolicy"></xref> for details.

target.mrk: When authentication is enabled and a Java Security Manager is installed, additional permissions may need to be granted to users in the security policy used.
See <xref href="radminjmxenablepolicy.dita#radminjmxenablepolicy"></xref> for details.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could create a password file called <codeph>jmxremote.password</codeph>:

seg-source.mrk: For example, you could create a password file called <codeph>jmxremote.password</codeph>:

target.mrk: For example, you could create a password file called <codeph>jmxremote.password</codeph>:

trans-unit.source: ## Defining two "roles", each with its own password monitorRole derbym controlRole derby

seg-source.mrk: ## Defining two "roles", each with its own password monitorRole derbym controlRole derby

target.mrk: ## Defining two "roles", each with its own password monitorRole derbym controlRole derby

trans-unit.source: The security of the password file relies on your file system's access control mechanisms. The file must be readable by the owner only. Also, you may need to change the permissions on the password file to be readable only by the user who starts the server. To do this on Windows (NTFS), use a command like the following:

seg-source.mrk: The security of the password file relies on your file system's access control mechanisms.
The file must be readable by the owner only.
Also, you may need to change the permissions on the password file to be readable only by the user who starts the server.
To do this on Windows (NTFS), use a command like the following:

target.mrk: The security of the password file relies on your file system's access control mechanisms.
The file must be readable by the owner only.
Also, you may need to change the permissions on the password file to be readable only by the user who starts the server.
To do this on Windows (NTFS), use a command like the following:

seg-source.mrk: cacls jmxremote.password /P username:R

target.mrk: cacls jmxremote.password /P username:R

trans-unit.source: FAT file systems do not support this feature.

seg-source.mrk: FAT file systems do not support this feature.

target.mrk: FAT file systems do not support this feature.

trans-unit.source: The following example starts the Network Server on the command line with built-in JMX password authentication enabled. SSL is disabled, meaning that JMX information, including user names and passwords most likely will be transferred unprotected on the computer network. The command line appears on multiple lines to improve readability, but you would enter it as a single <codeph>java</codeph> command.

seg-source.mrk: The following example starts the Network Server on the command line with built-in JMX password authentication enabled.
SSL is disabled, meaning that JMX information, including user names and passwords most likely will be transferred unprotected on the computer network.
The command line appears on multiple lines to improve readability, but you would enter it as a single <codeph>java</codeph> command.

target.mrk: The following example starts the Network Server on the command line with built-in JMX password authentication enabled.
SSL is disabled, meaning that JMX information, including user names and passwords most likely will be transferred unprotected on the computer network.
The command line appears on multiple lines to improve readability, but you would enter it as a single <codeph>java</codeph> command.

trans-unit.source: It is not recommended to disable SSL in production environments.

seg-source.mrk: It is not recommended to disable SSL in production environments.

target.mrk: It is not recommended to disable SSL in production environments.

seg-source.mrk: java -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port=9999 -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.ssl=false -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.password.file=jmxremote.password -jar lib/derbyrun.jar server start

target.mrk: java -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port=9999 -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.ssl=false -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.password.file=jmxremote.password -jar lib/derbyrun.jar server start
